diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Gallstone pancreatitis and choledocolithiasis (gallstone in duct)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of gallstone pancreatitis is supported by the patient's history of gallstones, elevated lipase levels (>1000), abdominal ultrasound findings of gallstones and gallbladder wall thickening, as well as MRCP findings indicating minimal gallbladder wall edema and thickening. Choledocolithiasis was indicated by the presence of a stone in the gallbladder neck or cystic duct.
